alert.note: Alert for Rabun (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 6:10AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...PATCHY BLACK ICE EARLY THIS MORNING ACROSS PARTS OF THE MOUNTAINS OF NORTH CAROLINA AND NORTHEAST GEORGIA... Temperatures below freezing early this morning may result in patches of black ice on untreated and secondary roads across mountain locations that received snow yesterday. In addition, patches of freezing fog have been observed in parts of the Little Tennessee River Valley early this morning. Both the black ice and freezing fog could result in slippery spots on some roadways. Use caution if driving in the North Carolina mountains or adjacent locales in northeast Georgia. Temperatures should rise above freezing and permit melting and drying by midday Tuesday.
